instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message: Another mess board no sign of water board looks good, and all other parts from mac is tested with another board. Where to start ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message: Tell us at least if you get some voltages on the board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message: its not going to dfu,everywhere where should be 3.4v is 3.2v and ppbus 12.30-34

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message: And when i connect battery then it shows 20v 0a, when battery disconnected then 5v 0.60-75ma

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message: I think some problem with this line F7000 not getting ppbus

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message:
No idea where did you find 3.2V and where do you expect 3.4V on this board.
Apart of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> LDOs, nothing else can appear before <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
But you've said to have 12.3V there.
Please, post accurate information...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message: And board model is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message:
Ooops sorry, F7000 is not placed on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on this board.
Do you get AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message:
Then should appear into DFU.
SSD and G3S voltages present too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message: 5.06v 0.067ma and still not showing dfu, can u name specific controllers what to check for ssd and g3s or some resistors what voltages u need to know

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, 5v 100ma
threads.message:
Check in schematic/boardview for any power rail ending with _G3S.
Look on page 67, System Power States.
